item.title: Former YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki has passed away at age 56
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Tragedy has again struck a famous Silicon Valley family. Former YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki has passed away, according to social media posts by her husband, Dennis Troper, and by Google CEO Sundar Pichai. She was 56. Wrote Troper on Facebook earlier Friday night, “It is with profound sadness that I share the news of Susan […]

item.description:
This is the second cyberattack targeting the school device management service Mobile Guardian this year.

item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
India's wearable market declined in Q2, primarily because smartwatch are not attracting consumers.

item.title: Anysphere, a GitHub Copilot rival, has raised $60M Series A at $400M valuation from a16z, Thrive, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Anysphere, a two-year-old startup that’s developed an AI-powered coding assistant called Cursor, has raised over $60 million in a Series A financing at a $400 million post-money valuation, two sources familiar with the deal told TechCrunch.  The round was co-led by Andreessen Horowitz and Thrive Capital. Patrick Collison, co-founder and CEO of Stripe, also participated […]

item.title: How to ask Google to remove deepfake porn results from Google Search
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The internet is full of deepfakes — and most of them are nudes. According to a report from Home Security Heroes, deepfake porn makes up 98% of all deepfake videos online. Thanks to easy-to-use and freely available generative AI tools, the number of deepfakes online — many of which aren’t consensual — skyrocketed 550% from […]

item.title: Ecovacs home robots can be hacked to spy on their owners, researchers say
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Researchers found flaws that could allow anyone to spy on the owners of Ecovacs home robots by hijacking their cameras and microphones.

item.title: Substack now lets anyone publish posts, even if they don’t have a newsletter
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Substack is opening up to more users with its recent announcement that anyone can now publish content on its platform without setting up a publication. With the change, Substack is likely looking to attract more types of writers and content creators, not just people who are interested in creating regularly distributed long-form written pieces. While […]

item.title: China’s autonomous vehicle startup WeRide prepares for a US IPO
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
WeRide, a Chinese autonomous vehicle company, is officially gearing up for a U.S. public debut, over a year after China started easing its effective ban of foreign IPOs.  WeRide registered 1 billion American Depository Receipts (ADRs) at a maximum price of $0.05, with the aggregate offering coming in at $50 million, per a Friday filing […]

item.title: How a cybersecurity researcher befriended, then doxed, the leader of LockBit ransomware gang
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Jon DiMaggio used sockpuppet accounts, then his own identity, to infiltrate LockBit and gain the trust of its alleged admin, Dmitry Khoroshev.

item.title: As unrest fueled by disinformation spreads, the UK may seek stronger power to regulate tech platforms
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
The U.K. government has indicated it may seek stronger powers to regulate tech platforms following days of violent disorder across England and Northern Ireland fueled by the spread of online disinformation. On Friday Prime Minister Keir Starmer confirmed there will be a review of the Online Safety Act (OSA). The legislation, which was passed by […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Lyft Price Lock could be an affordable alternative to surge pricing
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Lyft is working on a new feature that could help eliminate the pain of surge pricing. With Price Lock, Lyft says you’ll be able to pay a monthly fee to cap the price on a specific route at a specific time of day. So it could be particularly useful for riders who rely on Lyft […]

item.description:
The Startup Battlefield is the crown jewel of Disrupt, and we can’t wait to see which of the thousands of applicants will be selected to pitch to panels of top-tier VCs at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024, taking place on October 28–30 in San Francisco. item.title: Humidity sucks. Transaera has a new way to deal with it
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The startup's core technology is a proprietary material that absorbs moisture from the air, allowing air conditioning to cool buildings more efficiently.

item.title: YouTube is testing a sleep timer on its Premium tier

item.description:
YouTube's latest test involves a sleep timer that pauses the video after, well, a set period of time.

item.title: Ola Electric surges 20% in India’s biggest listing in two years
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Ola Electric, India’s largest electric two-wheeler maker, surged by 20% on its public debut on Friday, making it the biggest listing among Indian firms in two years. Shares of the Bengaluru-based firm, which counts SoftBank and Temasek among its backers, jumped to ₹91.20 (about $1.1) after starting to trade at ₹76, the higher end of […]

item.title: Rocket Lab’s sunny outlook bodes well for future constellation plans
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Rocket Lab surpassed $100 million in quarterly revenue for the first time, a 71% increase from the same quarter of last year. This is just one of several shiny accomplishments executives showed off to investors on Thursday — and a good omen for the space company’s medium-term ambitious plans. item.title: CloudPay, a payroll services provider, lands $120M in new funding
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
In 1996, two companies, Patersons HR and Payroll Solutions, formed a venture called CloudPay to provide payroll and payments services to enterprise clients. CloudPay grew quietly over the next several decades, adding workflow automation features to maintain pace with upstart rivals. It’s still growing, CFO Andy Thomson assures TechCrunch. Thomson claims that CloudPay is handling […]
